title: Conducting a Simulation
question_text: Which of the following is false regarding the use of simulation?

choices.text: We might choose to conduct a simulation because gathering the desired data by means of an experiment may be considered unethical.
We might choose to conduct a simulation because we want to gain insight into real world probabilities or expected values.
Conducting a well designed simulation can mimic real world outcomes.
Conducting a simulation can help to establish a cause and effect relationship between two variables.
A simulation must be repeated many times in order to provide reliable information about probabilities.

solution:
The best way to establish a cause and effect relationship between two variables is by conducting a well-designed experiment. A simulation cannot establish a cause and effect relationship.

Explanation of Distractors

Choices 'A', 'B', 'C' and 'E' are all correct statements regarding the use of simulation.
